title: P05-1076

sentences.text: This paper describes a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames -LRB- scfs -RRB- and associated frequency information from English corpus data .
The system incorporates a decision-tree classifier for 30 scf types which tests for the presence of grammatical relations -LRB- grs -RRB- in the output of a robust statistical parser .
It uses a powerful pattern-matching language to classify grs into frames hierarchically in a way that mirrors inheritance-based lexica .
The experiments show that the system is able to detect scf types with 70 % precision and 66 % recall rate .
A new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs in corpus data is also introduced which can considerably alleviate the process of obtaining training and test data for subcategorization acquisition .

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel system designed to acquire adjectival subcategorization frames (scfs) and their frequency information from English corpus data, utilizing a decision-tree classifier and a pattern-matching language for hierarchical classification.

Entity-30_scf_type.label: 30 scf types
Entity-30_scf_type.description: The term '30 scf types' refers to a classification system for thirty distinct adjectival subcategorization frames used in linguistic analysis, which are identified through a decision-tree classifier that evaluates grammatical relations in parsed English corpus data.

Entity-system.label: system
Entity-system.description: The system is a novel tool designed for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data, utilizing a decision-tree classifier and a pattern-matching language to analyze grammatical relations.

Entity-scfs_in_corpus_data.label: scfs in corpus data
Entity-scfs_in_corpus_data.description: Scfs in corpus data refers to adjectival subcategorization frames that are extracted and annotated from English linguistic corpora to facilitate the acquisition of grammatical relations and improve the training and testing processes for subcategorization systems.

Entity-new_tool_for_linguistic_annotatio.label: new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs
aliases: A new tool for linguistic annotation
new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs
Entity-new_tool_for_linguistic_annotatio.description: The new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs is a software system designed to facilitate the annotation of adjectival subcategorization frames in corpus data, thereby streamlining the process of gathering training and test data for subcategorization acquisition.

mentions.local_name: new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs
A new tool for linguistic annotation

Entity-scf_type.label: scf types
Entity-scf_type.description: The term 'scf types' refers to the 30 distinct adjectival subcategorization frames used in a system that classifies grammatical relations in English corpus data.

Entity-a_novel_system_for_acquiring_adje.label: a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames
aliases: a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames
Entity-a_novel_system_for_acquiring_adje.description: The entity refers to an innovative computational system designed to extract adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data, utilizing a decision-tree classifier and a pattern-matching language to analyze grammatical relations and enhance linguistic annotation.

mentions.local_name: a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames

Entity-grs.label: grs
Entity-grs.description: In this paper, 'grs' refers to grammatical relations that are identified and classified within a system designed for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data.

Entity-66__recall_rate.label: 66 % recall rate
Entity-66__recall_rate.description: The '66 % recall rate' refers to the effectiveness of the system in correctly identifying adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data, indicating that 66% of the actual instances of these frames were successfully detected by the system.

Entity-adjectival_subcategorization_fram.label: adjectival subcategorization frames
Entity-adjectival_subcategorization_fram.description: Adjectival subcategorization frames (scfs) are linguistic structures that categorize the grammatical relations associated with adjectives in a language, specifically focusing on how adjectives can be combined with other elements in sentences.

Entity-frame_hierarchically.label: frames hierarchically
Entity-frame_hierarchically.description: The term 'frames hierarchically' refers to the structured classification of grammatical relations into hierarchical frames within a system designed for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data.

Entity-subcategorization_acquisition.label: subcategorization acquisition
Entity-subcategorization_acquisition.description: Subcategorization acquisition is the process by which language learners or computational models acquire knowledge about the syntactic subcategorization frames of verbs, including the types and structures of arguments they can take.

Entity-powerful_pattern-matching_languag.label: powerful pattern-matching language
Entity-powerful_pattern-matching_languag.description: The powerful pattern-matching language refers to a specialized linguistic tool used in the system described in the paper for classifying grammatical relations into hierarchical frames, facilitating the acquisition of adjectival subcategorization frames from English corpus data.

Entity-the_experiment.label: the experiments
Entity-the_experiment.description: The experiments refer to the evaluations conducted to assess the performance of the novel system in detecting adjectival subcategorization frame types, demonstrating a precision of 70% and a recall rate of 66%.

Entity-training_and_test_data_for_subcat.label: training and test data for subcategorization acquisition
aliases: training and test data for subcategorization acquisition
Entity-training_and_test_data_for_subcat.description: training and test data for subcategorization acquisition refers to datasets specifically designed for the purpose of training models and evaluating their performance in the task of identifying and categorizing the subcategorization frames of words or phrases in linguistic data.

mentions.local_name: training and test data for subcategorization acquisition

Entity-frequency_information.label: frequency information
Entity-frequency_information.description: Frequency information refers to the statistical data regarding the occurrence rates of adjectival subcategorization frames extracted from English corpus data.

Entity-tool.label: tool
Entity-tool.description: The 'tool' refers to a new software designed for linguistic annotation of adjectival subcategorization frames in corpus data, aimed at facilitating the acquisition of training and test data for subcategorization tasks.

Entity-70__precision.label: 70 % precision
Entity-70__precision.description: 70 % precision refers to the accuracy of the system in correctly identifying adjectival subcategorization frame types in the experiments conducted, indicating that 70 % of the detected instances were correct.

Entity-robust_statistical_parser.label: robust statistical parser
Entity-robust_statistical_parser.description: A robust statistical parser is a computational tool that analyzes and interprets the grammatical structure of sentences using statistical methods, providing output that can be utilized for further linguistic processing, such as identifying grammatical relations in the context of subcategorization frame acquisition.

Entity-decision-tree_classifier.label: decision-tree classifier
Entity-decision-tree_classifier.description: A decision-tree classifier is a type of machine learning algorithm that uses a tree-like model of decisions and their possible consequences to classify data into distinct categories.

Entity-the_process_of_obtaining_training.label: the process of obtaining training and test data
aliases: the process of obtaining training and test data
Entity-the_process_of_obtaining_training.description: The process of obtaining training and test data refers to the systematic collection and preparation of datasets necessary for training machine learning models and evaluating their performance, particularly in the context of subcategorization frame acquisition from linguistic corpora.

mentions.local_name: the process of obtaining training and test data

Entity-inheritance-based_lexica.label: inheritance-based lexica
Entity-inheritance-based_lexica.description: Inheritance-based lexica refer to linguistic resources that organize lexical items hierarchically, allowing for the inheritance of properties and relations among words, which is utilized in the classification of grammatical relations in the context of subcategorization frames.

Entity-precision.label: precision
Entity-precision.description: In this context, 'precision' refers to the evaluation metric that quantifies the accuracy of the system in correctly identifying adjectival subcategorization frame types, specifically indicating that 70% of the detected instances were true positives.

Entity-english_corpus_data.label: English corpus data
Entity-english_corpus_data.description: English corpus data refers to a collection of written or spoken texts in the English language that is used for linguistic analysis and research.

Entity-corpus_data.label: corpus data
Entity-corpus_data.description: Corpus data refers to a collection of written or spoken texts that are used for linguistic analysis and research, serving as a resource for studying language patterns and structures.

Entity-pattern-matching_language.label: pattern-matching language
Entity-pattern-matching_language.description: A pattern-matching language is a type of programming language or computational tool designed to identify and manipulate patterns within data or structures, often used in fields such as artificial intelligence, data processing, and linguistics.

Entity-statistical_parser.label: statistical parser
Entity-statistical_parser.description: A statistical parser is a natural language processing tool that analyzes and interprets the grammatical structure of sentences using probabilistic models.

Entity-recall_rate.label: recall rate
Entity-recall_rate.description: Recall rate is an evaluation metric that measures the proportion of true positive results in relation to the total number of actual positive cases, indicating the effectiveness of a system in identifying relevant instances.

Entity-training_and_test_data.label: training and test data
Entity-training_and_test_data.description: Training and test data refers to datasets used in machine learning and statistical modeling, where the training data is used to train models and the test data is used to evaluate their performance.

Entity-linguistic_annotation.label: linguistic annotation
Entity-linguistic_annotation.description: Linguistic annotation is a methodology and process used to add interpretative information to linguistic data, facilitating the analysis and understanding of language structures and meanings.

Entity-test_data.label: test data
Entity-test_data.description: Test data refers to a subset of data used to evaluate the performance of a machine learning model, ensuring that the model generalizes well to unseen data.

Entity-grammatical_relation.label: grammatical relations
Entity-grammatical_relation.description: Grammatical relations are the relationships between constituents in a sentence that define their syntactic roles and functions, such as subject, object, and adjunct.

Entity-experiment.label: experiments
Entity-experiment.description: Experiments are systematic investigations conducted to test hypotheses, evaluate outcomes, or explore phenomena, often involving controlled conditions and measurements.

summary: This paper describes a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames -LRB- scfs -RRB- and associated frequency information from English corpus data . The system incorporates a decision-tree classifier for 30 scf types which tests for the presence of grammatical relations -LRB- grs -RRB- in the output of a robust statistical parser . It uses a powerful pattern-matching language to classify grs into frames hierarchically in a way that mirrors inheritance-based lexica . The experiments show that the system is able to detect scf types with 70 % precision and 66 % recall rate . A new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs in corpus data is also introduced which can considerably alleviate the process of obtaining training and test data for subcategorization acquisition .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' establishes a relationship where the subject provides an account, explanation, or representation of the object. It indicates that the subject conveys information or details about the object, enhancing the understanding of the object's characteristics, functions, or context.

Predicate-acquires.label: acquires
Predicate-acquires.description: The predicate 'acquires' indicates a relationship in which the subject obtains, gains, or comes into possession of the object. This implies a process of receiving or learning something new, where the subject enhances its capabilities, knowledge, or resources through the acquisition of the object.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject includes or integrates the object as a part of its structure, functionality, or operation. It suggests a relationship where the subject adopts or utilizes the object to enhance its capabilities or to achieve a specific purpose.

Predicate-tests_for_the_presence_of.label: tests for the presence of
Predicate-tests_for_the_presence_of.description: The predicate 'tests for the presence of' indicates an evaluative action performed by the subject, which involves examining or analyzing the object to determine whether it exists or is detectable within a given context or dataset. This relationship suggests that the subject is equipped to identify or confirm the occurrence of the object, which may refer to features, characteristics, or specific elements relevant to the subject's function or purpose.

Predicate-in_the_output_of.label: in the output of
Predicate-in_the_output_of.description: The predicate 'in the output of' indicates a relationship where the subject is a component or result that is produced or generated by the object. It signifies that the subject is found within the results or data generated by the process or system represented by the object.

Predicate-tests_for.label: tests for
Predicate-tests_for.description: The predicate 'tests for' indicates a relationship where the subject is used to evaluate, assess, or determine the presence, validity, or characteristics of the object. It implies that the subject performs an action or function that aims to identify or measure specific attributes or phenomena represented by the object.

Predicate-is_able_to_detect.label: is able to detect
Predicate-is_able_to_detect.description: The predicate 'is able to detect' indicates the capability or functionality of the subject to identify, recognize, or sense the presence of the object. It implies that the subject possesses the necessary mechanisms, tools, or processes to perceive or discern the characteristics or existence of the object in question.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a functional relationship where the subject employs or utilizes the object as a means to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. It signifies that the subject actively engages with the object in a way that facilitates a process, operation, or activity.

Predicate-classify_into.label: classify into
Predicate-classify_into.description: The predicate 'classify into' indicates a relationship where the subject is organized or categorized according to specific criteria or characteristics that define the object. This implies that the subject is being sorted or grouped into a particular classification or framework represented by the object, often suggesting a hierarchical or systematic arrangement.

Predicate-mirrors.label: mirrors
Predicate-mirrors.description: The predicate 'mirrors' indicates a relationship where the subject reflects or represents the characteristics, structure, or properties of the object. In this context, it suggests that the subject serves as a representation or analogy for the object, highlighting similarities or parallels between the two.

Predicate-classifies.label: classifies
Predicate-classifies.description: The predicate 'classifies' denotes a relationship in which the subject is used to categorize or group the object based on shared characteristics or criteria. It implies that the subject provides a framework or system that helps to identify and organize the object within a specific classification scheme.

Predicate-are_classified_into.label: are classified into
Predicate-are_classified_into.description: The predicate 'are classified into' indicates a relationship where the subject is organized or categorized into specific groups or types represented by the object. This classification implies a systematic arrangement based on shared characteristics or criteria, allowing for a structured understanding of the subject's components or variations.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: The predicate 'show that' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence, results, or findings that support or demonstrate the validity of the object. It implies a process of revealing or proving a particular fact, conclusion, or state of affairs related to the object based on the information or data presented by the subject.

Predicate-achieves.label: achieves
Predicate-achieves.description: The predicate 'achieves' indicates that the subject successfully reaches or attains a specific level, standard, or goal represented by the object. It implies a positive outcome or result of an effort or process, often quantifying the success in measurable terms.

Predicate-have.label: have
Predicate-have.description: The predicate 'have' indicates a relationship where the subject possesses or contains the object, which often represents a characteristic, quality, or measurable attribute associated with the subject. In this context, it signifies that the subject is characterized by the object, establishing a connection that reflects ownership or a defining feature.

Predicate-is_introduced.label: is introduced
Predicate-is_introduced.description: The predicate 'is introduced' signifies the action of presenting or bringing something into a particular context or system for the first time. It establishes a relationship where the subject is the entity being presented, and the object represents the context, framework, or system in which the subject is being integrated or made known.

Predicate-alleviates.label: alleviates
Predicate-alleviates.description: The predicate 'alleviates' indicates that the subject provides relief or reduces the difficulty, burden, or severity of the object. It suggests a positive impact where the subject contributes to making the object easier to manage or less problematic.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' establishes a relationship of purpose or intended use between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject serves a specific function or is designed to achieve the goal represented by the object. In this context, the subject is typically a resource, tool, or concept, while the object represents an activity, process, or outcome that the subject supports or facilitates.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or delivering information, findings, or concepts related to the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject actively communicates or reveals the object to an audience, often in a formal or structured context.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or a more inclusive definition that includes the subject as a subset.
